thread.title: Manchester United transfer news: Ashley Young linked with shock move to Chinese Super League side Shandong Luneng
thread.title_full: Manchester United transfer news: Ashley Young linked with shock move to Chinese Super League side Shandong Luneng

author: dfraser
title: Manchester United transfer news: Ashley Young linked with shock move to Chinese Super League side Shandong Luneng

organizations.name: shandong luneng ash to ashes manchester united

text:
Ash to Ashes Manchester United transfer news: Ashley Young linked with shock move to Chinese Super League side Shandong Luneng 
Former Aston Villa winger about to link up with Felix Magath, Papiss Cisse and Graziano Pelle in China, according to reports Gossip Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MANCHESTER UNITED winger Ashley Young may still be on the verge of a move away from Old Trafford, with Chinese Super League side Shandong Luneng. 
The former Aston Villa star, 31, was linked with a move away from Jose Mourinho ‘s men all winter, but managed to cling on to his spot. Getty Images 3 Ashley Young could be offered a mega money move to China 
However, with the Chinese Super League transfer window not closing until the end of February, Young may yet leave the Premier League. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United and Chinese Super League news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
Shandong Luneng are the side keen to add another splash of Premier League to their squad, with former Fulham boss Felix Magath – a man famous for his bizarre ‘cheese’ treatment – in charge. 
Elsewhere former Southampton striker Graziano Pelle and ex-Newcastle forward Papiss Cisse are also on the books – two of the first players to up sticks and kick-off a Chinese revolution. Ashley Young reveals bizarre chip eating habit in exclusive interview for kicca.com Shandong Luneng are still trying to sign Ashley Young before close of Chinese transfer window - remain in talks with representatives 
— Dean Jones (@DeanJonesBR) February 22, 2017 PA:Press Association Archive 3 Ashley Young could still make a move away from Manchester United this month 
Young was in fact denied to chance to head off on loan in January , with Mourinho unwilling to part with the ex-Watford man after losing Morgan Schneiderlin and Memphis Depay in quick succession. 
The 31-cap England international started his career in the Hornets' youth setup before bagging a move to Aston Villa in 2007. 
After four season of tormenting defences in the Midlands, Sir Alex Ferguson came knocking, landing his man for around £20million. PA:Press Association Archive 3 Ashley Young has been at Manchester United since 2007 after leaving Aston Villa 
However, he has struggled to make an impression in the past two seasons, with Mourinho even limiting him to just six Premier League appearances this term. 
With his time seemingly up, he could make his move this month rather than wait until the summer.
